title.narrative: CASE MNGT & SPECIALISED SERVICES IN CP

description.narrative: By the end of 2016, the child protection system applies a case management approach to its child clients and ensures the availability and functioning of specialized services in accordance with international standards and best interests of children, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country infrastructure-child rights tructure for the increased realization of child rights, through: i) increased prevention and intervention for the protection of children from violence, abuse and neglect, ii) the planning, budgeting and monitoring of policies and decisions of national and subnational authorities, which will increasingly address social exclusion of children and iii) the increased engagement of public and private stakeholders in supporting children's rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2016, the child protection system applies a case management approach to its child clients and ensures theavailability and functioning of specialized services in accordance with international standards and best interests of children

description.narrative: Noticeable progress achieved in strengthening child protection and justice system to apply child friendly practices, both in family based care and in justice for children areas, as reflected through output indicators. Additional contribution has been made in supporting emergency response to refugee and migrant crisis according to CCC. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2017

title.narrative: of courts implementing child-friendly procedure for child victims and witnesses in criminal proceedings

target.value: 2016:At least 10 key county courts implementing child-friendly procedure for child victims and witnesses in criminal proceedings

actual.value: 2016:COMPLETED10 key criminal courts are technically and staffing wise equipped to implement child-friendly procedures. In addition in 2016 the role of the criminal court staff (non-legal child professionals) who implement child-friendly procedures has been strengthened.

title.narrative: of counties providing diversion measure for youth in conflict with law

actual.value: 2016:COMPLETED Diversion measure, Out-of-court settlement for juveniles in conflict with the law have been established in all 21 counties. Financial means for their implementation during 2016 have been secured through the regular budget of Ministry for Demography, Family, Youth and Social Policy.

title.narrative: The set of legal obligations and statutory provisions are included in the national legal framework as per the UN Guidelines on justice in matters involving child victims and witnesses of crime and Council of Europe Guidelines

actual.value: 2016:According to Croatian law children's cases are handled by specialized professionals. The police employs police officers for youth, at the court level there are youth judges and non-legal child professionals (social pedagogues and social workers), and the public prosecutor's offices employ non-legal

title.narrative: Regulatory framework (by-laws, standards and protocols) for implementing social welfare intervention (supervision over parental care)

actual.value: 2016:COMPLETED The by-law within the Family Law adopted in September 2015 regulates implementation of the social welfare intervention (supervision over parental care). The intervention was additionally improved within the Law and guidelines and social work instruments are provided within the by-law.

title.narrative: Regulatory framework (by-laws, standards and protocols) related to continuous education, monitoring and support to foster care providers

actual.value: 2016:DELAYEDThe process of ensuring continuous education, monitoring and support to foster care providers was initiated in the first half of the 2016, to provide grounds for legislation changes and improvements. Political instability in the Country delayed the process, which is expected to continue in 2
